message: I am using Django Minugs on my site and just wanted to redirect my feed through feedburner for stats and all that.
In my posts I am using textile for markup and feedburner seems to ignore this - displays the posts not rendered to html
I guess that's an error on my site - does anyone now what setting I messed up? Anyone experienced with Mingus here?
For each RSS feeds, you have a template for the title (default to feeds/<rss feed name>_title.html) and a template for the content itself (default to feeds/<rss feed name>_description.html).
In those template, you have to process the post.content or whatever to render the textile into html
In case you need it, there's a Textile template filter provided by Django: http://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.2/ref/contrib/markup/

Thanks for the replies. I took a closer look at the site and it is running django 1.1 - so the syndication framework isn't the same - at least from looking at the docs, it looks a lot different: http://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.1/ref/contrib/syndication/
Gotta take some more time to get this all working. Thanks for your help though.
@skohler still no luck? the above advice is the solution. if you've added the textile template tag to fix an existing issue feedburner probably cached the older, unformatted textile version.
In the 1.1 docs there is nothing about the rendering of textile or markdown to be found.
@montylounge You are here too, nice! Well, the solution is perfect for Django 1.2 - as far as I understand it. I am running Mingus with 1.1!
Or maybe I was just smoking crack when reading the docs - let me check again.
@TylerDurden  @eppsilon  @montylounge Thanks guys! It is working now. Nice to see things working once you do them in the way they are intended.
no sweat @skohler - i'm happy to help.
@skohler Happy to be of any help.
